009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015
016import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Vector version (applicable to ColorProcessor only) of a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter described in [1].
021 * It structures the filter region into five overlapping, square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x
022 * (r+1). See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] F. Tomita and S. Tsuji. Extraction of multiple regions by smoothing in selected neighborhoods. IEEE Transactions
026 * on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics 7, 394â€“407 (1977).
027 * <br>
028 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2021/01/02
034 */
035public class KuwaharaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements KuwaharaF {
036        
037        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
038        private final int dm;                   // = d-
039        private final int dp;                   // = d+
040        private final float tsigma;
041
042        // constructor using default settings
043        public KuwaharaFilterVector() {
044                this(new Parameters());
045        }
046        
047        public KuwaharaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
048                int r = params.radius;
049                this.n = sqr(r + 1);    // size of complete filter
050                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
051                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
052                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
053        }
054        
055        // ------------------------------------------------------
056
057        private final float[] Amin = new float[3];
058        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
059        private float Smin;             // min. variance
060
061        @Override
062        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v)  {
063                Smin = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
064                evalSubregion(pack, u, v);                              // centered subregion - different to original Kuwahara!
065                Smin = Smin - 3 * tsigma * n;                   // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
066                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dm);
067                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dp);
068                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dm);
069                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dp);
070                Matrix.copyD(Amin, rgb);
071                return rgb;
072        } 
073        
074        private void evalSubregion(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
075                // evaluate the subregion centered at (u,v)
076                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
077                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
078                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
079                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {                
080                                float[] cp = source.getPix(u + i, v + j);
081
082                                S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
083                                S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
084                                S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
085                                
086                                S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
087                                S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
088                                S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
089                        }
090                }
091                // calculate the variance for this subregion:
092//              S[0] = S2[0] - S1[0] * S1[0] / n;
093//              S[1] = S2[1] - S1[1] * S1[1] / n;
094//              S[2] = S2[2] - S1[2] * S1[2] / n;
095                // total variance (scaled by n):
096//              float Srgb = S[0] + S[1] + S[2];
097                float Srgb = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) + S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) + S2[2] - sqr(S1[2])) / n;
098                if (Srgb < Smin) { 
099                        Smin = Srgb;
100                        Amin[0] = S1[0] / n;
101                        Amin[1] = S1[1] / n;
102                        Amin[2] = S1[2] / n;
103                }
104        }
105
106}
